title: Chord: 13th in A# (Shape: D)
content:
# Chord: 13th in A# (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th chord in A# with the D shape is a rich and complex chord that adds color and depth to a musical piece. It consists of the notes A#, F, C, G#, and D#. The 13th chord in this particular shape opens up a world of musical possibilities and can be used to create lush and sophisticated harmonies.

## Notes and Intervals
- A# (Root)
- F (5th)
- C (9th)
- G# (13th)
- D# (major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in A# with the D shape is commonly found in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to compositions, giving them a sophisticated and elegant sound. This chord is often used to create tension and release, adding depth and emotion to the music.

## 3 Songs
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra** - This classic jazz standard uses the 13th chord in various arrangements to create a smooth and sophisticated sound.
2. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder** - Stevie Wonder incorporates the 13th chord in A# (Shape: D) in this upbeat and joyful R&B hit, adding a touch of soulful charm to the music.
3. **"Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles** - This timeless ballad features the 13th chord in A# (Shape: D), enhancing the heartfelt and emotional melody of the song.
